circumstances: During the takeoff roll at Corpus Christi Airport, the pilot decided to abandon the procedure and started an emergency braking procedure. In unclear circumstances, the twin engine airplane went out of control, veered off runway and came to rest. All nine occupants escaped uninjured while the aircraft was damaged beyond repair.
probable_cause:
The pilot exercised poor judgment and lost control of the airplane in unfavorable wind conditions. The following factors were reported: 
- Overload failure, 
- Right cross wind 068 to 112°,
- 070° right crosswind gusting up to 24 knots.
